component.name: DropdownMenu
component.description: Present a discoverable list of actions or choices triggered by a button.

useCases: User needs to choose an action from a short list
Actions are contextually related to the trigger
Overflow actions that do not fit in the primary UI
Settings or preferences with checkbox/radio items

commonPatterns.name: basic-dropdown
commonPatterns.description: Simple action menu triggered by a button

commonPatterns.name: checkbox-items
commonPatterns.description: Toggle multiple options on/off within the menu

commonPatterns.name: radio-items
commonPatterns.description: Select one option from a group within the menu
commonPatterns.composition:
<DropdownMenu>
  <DropdownMenuTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant="outline">Sort</Button>
  </DropdownMenuTrigger>
  <DropdownMenuContent>
    <DropdownMenuRadioGroup value={sort} onValueChange={setSort}>
      <DropdownMenuRadioItem value="name">Name</DropdownMenuRadioItem>
      <DropdownMenuRadioItem value="date">Date</DropdownMenuRadioItem>
    </DropdownMenuRadioGroup>
  </DropdownMenuContent>
</DropdownMenu>

commonPatterns.name: with-shortcuts
commonPatterns.description: Menu items showing keyboard shortcut hints

antiPatterns.scenario: Placing form fields inside a DropdownMenu
antiPatterns.reason: DropdownMenu is for choosing actions, not configuring settings with inputs
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Popover for interactive, form-based content

antiPatterns.reason: DropdownMenu is button-triggered; right-click has its own primitive
Menu closes after selection; it cannot manage multi-step interactions
antiPatterns.alternative: Use AlertDialog or Modal for confirmation flows

semanticMeaning.destructive: Dangerous or irreversible action; renders in destructive color

subComponents.DropdownMenuTrigger: Button or element that opens the menu; supports asChild
subComponents.DropdownMenuContent: Floating panel rendered via Portal with animation; positioned relative to trigger
subComponents.DropdownMenuItem: Single actionable item; supports inset and destructive variant
subComponents.DropdownMenuRadioGroup: Container for mutually exclusive radio items
subComponents.DropdownMenuRadioItem: Selectable radio item with circle indicator
subComponents.DropdownMenuSeparator: Visual divider between groups of items
subComponents.DropdownMenuSubTrigger: Item that opens a submenu on hover/focus; shows chevron indicator

interactions.click: Opens the menu from trigger; selects and closes from items
interactions.hover: Highlights items; opens submenus on hover
interactions.escape: Closes the menu and returns focus to trigger

responsive.mobile: Menu renders as a floating panel; min-width 8rem
responsive.desktop: Same floating behavior with keyboard navigation

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Arrow keys to navigate items; Enter/Space to select; Escape to close; right arrow opens submenu; left arrow closes submenu
accessibility.screenReader: Announces menu role, item labels, checked state for checkbox/radio items, and keyboard shortcuts
accessibility.focusManagement: Focus trapped within open menu; returns to trigger on close

rules: Triggered by a button — never opens automatically
Each item performs a single action or selection
DropdownMenu is for choosing actions, not configuring settings
Do not place form fields inside a DropdownMenu
Use destructive variant on DropdownMenuItem for dangerous actions

aiHints.context: Use DropdownMenu for discoverable action lists triggered by a button. It is for choosing actions, not configuring settings — use Popover for that. Do not place form fields inside a DropdownMenu. Use ContextMenu when triggered by right-click. For split-button patterns, pair DropdownMenu with ButtonGroup.
